Publications

All content, all the time.

Note: PDFs of select manuscripts are available here for non-commercial use; please adhere to the publishers' guidelines regarding use and distribution. If any of the following manuscripts are not available to you, please email me and I will gladly send you a copy.

Peer-reviewed Publications

    In Press, In Review, or In Preparation

      Yair SS, S Struckman, AR Kula, MD LaMar, and HJ Dalgleish. (In Prep). Herbivory as a continuous state variable in an IPM: demographic impacts of mean and variance among individuals. Target journal: AoB Plants

    2021

  1. Lutz, JA, S Struckman, SJ Germain, and TJ Furniss. (2021). The importance of large-diameter trees to deadwood biomass. Ecological Processes, 10: 28. doi.org/10.1186/s13717-021-00299-0.

  2. Lutz, JA, S Struckman, TJ Furniss, JD Birch, LL Yocom, and DJ McAvoy. (2021). Large-diameter trees, snags, and deadwood in southern Utah, USA. Ecological Processes, 10: 9. doi.org/10.1186/s13717-020-00275-0.

    3. 2020

  3. Lutz, JA, S Struckman, TJ Furniss, CA Cansler, SJ Germain, LL Yocom, DJ McAvoy, CA Kolden, AMS Smith, ME Swanson, and AJ Larson. (2020). Large-diameter trees dominate snag and surface biomass following reintroduced fire. Ecological Processes, 9: 41. doi.org/10.1186/s13717-020-00243-8.

    4. 2019

  4. Struckman, S, JJ Couture, MD LaMar, and HJ Dalgleish. (2019). The demographic effects of functional traits: an integral projection model approach reveals population-level consequences of reproduction-defense trade-offs. Ecology Letters, 22: 1396â€“1406. doi.org/10.1111/ele.13325.
